description:
New orders excluding major orders: Value index

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
42151 Indices of new orders in manufacturing

Definition:
The index calculation is based on the total of the values of
the orders definitely accepted in the reference month. To
calculate the index excluding major orders, major orders are
subtracted from the values of new orders in the reference
month. This total of values is related to the relevant
monthly average excluding major orders in the base year and
forms the value index for an economic branch.
These indices are aggregated to form indices for
"manufacturing" and for its main industrial groupings. This
is done by means of the proportions of the values of new
orders excluding major orders in the base year.
